Keywords: Avengers , Martial Artist , Past , S.H.I.E.L.D. , Soldier
Real Name: Steve Rogers
Special Powers
INSPIRATIONAL PARAGON: When Captain America removes an action token from a friendly character (including himself) when using Leadership or Willpower, after resolutions you may heal that character 2 clicks.
SHIELD RICOCHET: Improved Targeting: Hindering, Elevated, Characters.

Comments
November 30, 2022
SuperClixer
Due to Power Creep, I feel Legacy Cards are not, for the most part, making figures competitive with new figurers. This is a good example of that. They should be adding a Trait or SP that gives a +1; +2; or +3 to attack, defense, and sometimes damage combat values, where needed. This figure would be competitive with new figures of today, if it at least had a +1, of not a +2. to some or all Attack and Defense values.
November 4, 2022
The Singularity
It's kind of a bummer... how long have we all speculated that the great and beloved smokey feet cap would get a legacy card? Now we finally have one and it just falls so flat. Certainly this legacy card is not bringing back the excitement and flavor the figure had in its heyday.
October 28, 2022
Havickzbeck
I'm on the same page as pokolo here. On top of that there are 30 point Starter figs that tower over this. This isn't worth more than 40 points max.
October 24, 2022
pokolo
Interesting update, like the trait, but wanted a little more from this… he needs help with his attack value, was hoping he’d get RCE added to the attack special and traited sidestep/charge to help with the lack of move and attack late dial. Also kinda wish he was given the Living Legend trait. I guess I should learn to lower my expectations for these LC’s (even though Thanos set the bar) but for being such a legendary figure that so many players wanted, I wish he had been given a little more oomph. They could have just given him the improved targeting symbols on the card by the picture to make the attack special something new and interesting
October 24, 2022
Hellboy the Bellboy
Special attack power should be called: Shield ricochet. Not Shield rocket.
